outbound.notes: Travel during Thanksgiving weekend is a peak travel period, leading to significantly higher prices. These estimates are for domestic flights from a major US city. It is highly recommended to book flights as early as possible to secure better rates.

return.origin: New York Area Airports (JFK, LGA, EWR)
return.notes: Return travel during this period can also be expensive. Prices are highly variable based on origin, airline, and booking time. Booking early is crucial.

carRental.recommendation: Generally NOT recommended for extensive use within Manhattan due to extremely high parking costs (typically $50-$80+ per day), traffic congestion, and excellent public transportation. Consider only for specific day trips outside the city or for airport transfers if public transit or ride-shares are not suitable for luggage for 4 travelers.
carRental.carType: Mid-size SUV or Full-size Sedan (to comfortably accommodate 4 travelers and luggage)
carRental.notes: If renting for airport transfer only, consider picking up/dropping off at airports (JFK, LGA, EWR) to avoid city surcharges. For the full 7 days, a car rental could easily consume $490 - $910 of your budget, plus fuel, tolls, and parking, significantly impacting your remaining funds.

publicTransit.costInfo: Single ride: $2.90. 7-day Unlimited MetroCard: $34.00 per person. OMNY (tap-to-pay with credit/debit card or mobile wallet) offers fare capping equivalent to the 7-day unlimited pass.
publicTransit.notes: The subway is the fastest, most efficient, and most economical way to navigate NYC. For 4 people, especially with frequent use, the 7-day Unlimited MetroCard or OMNY's fare cap would be highly cost-effective. Plan routes using Google Maps or the official MTA app.

rideSharing.costInfo: Varies by distance, time of day, and demand (surge pricing common during peak hours). For 4 people, selecting 'Uber XL' or 'Lyft XL' will provide more space but costs more.
rideSharing.notes: Convenient for specific destinations, late-night travel, or when carrying luggage directly to/from accommodation. Can be a good option for airport transfers for 4 people, potentially comparable to or cheaper than a taxi, depending on the service level chosen.

taxi.costInfo: Metered fares within the city. Flat rate from JFK to Manhattan is $52 + tolls/surcharges. Fares from LGA and EWR vary. For 4 people, a taxi can be a competitive option for airport transfers.
taxi.notes: Readily available in Manhattan and at airports. Often preferred for direct routes and for groups with luggage.

localTransportation.totalEstimatedLocalTransportCost: Allow $200 - $450 for 4 people for 7 days, assuming a mix of public transit (e.g., 4 x $34 unlimited MetroCards) and several ride-shares/taxis for convenience or airport transfers.

budgetSummary.notes: Your budget of $3000 is tight, primarily due to the peak travel dates (Thanksgiving weekend) significantly increasing flight costs. Prioritize booking flights immediately. To stay within budget, it's strongly recommended to rely heavily on NYC's excellent public transportation and only use ride-shares/taxis when essential (e.g., airport transfers). A full 7-day car rental will likely push you over budget once parking, tolls, and fuel are factored in.

accommodation.description: Arlo NoMad offers a vibrant and stylish stay, perfectly suited for four travelers looking to dive into New York's adventure, nightlife, and culinary scenes. Situated in the trendy NoMad neighborhood, you're steps away from the bustling eateries of Koreatown, Madison Square Park, and a short distance from numerous subway lines for easy city exploration. The hotel features a highly acclaimed rooftop bar, offering spectacular cityscapes ideal for pre-dinner cocktails or a lively evening out. While rooms are thoughtfully designed for efficiency, options with two queen beds provide comfortable accommodation for a group of four. Its central location makes it an excellent base for discovering diverse dining, experiencing dynamic nightlife, and embarking on urban adventures throughout Manhattan.

activities.morning: Arrival in New York City, check into accommodation, and settle in. Take a leisurely stroll around your immediate neighborhood.
activities.afternoon: Explore Midtown Manhattan: iconic sights like Times Square (quick walk-through), Grand Central Terminal, and Bryant Park. Head to SUMMIT One Vanderbilt for late afternoon.
activities.evening: Experience breathtaking panoramic views from SUMMIT One Vanderbilt for sunset and city lights (allow 2-3 hours). Dinner: Grab a classic NYC street food experience from The Halal Guys for a casual, delicious meal.

dinner_recommendation.specialty: Famous street food cart known globally for its delicious chicken and gyro platters served with their iconic white sauce and fiery hot sauce.
mustTry: Chicken and Gyro Platter (with white sauce and hot sauce)

activities.morning: Brooklyn Bridge & DUMBO Exploration: Walk across the iconic Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan into Brooklyn. Spend time exploring the DUMBO neighborhood, Brooklyn Bridge Park, and take photos with the Manhattan skyline.
activities.afternoon: Enjoy lunch in DUMBO or Brooklyn Heights. Continue to explore the charming streets of Brooklyn Heights, known for its historic brownstones and scenic promenades.
activities.evening: Dinner in Brooklyn (e.g., Williamsburg or a local spot near DUMBO). Enjoy a relaxed evening after a day of walking.

dinner_recommendation.name: Local Brooklyn Spot
dinner_recommendation.specialty: Explore local eateries in DUMBO or Williamsburg for diverse dining options.
mustTry: Local artisanal pizza or a trendy restaurant

activities.morning: Leisurely morning. Enjoy a relaxed breakfast or visit a local coffee shop near your accommodation.
activities.afternoon: Chelsea Market & The High Line: Explore the vibrant Chelsea Market, an indoor food hall and shopping area. Afterwards, walk The High Line, an elevated urban park built on former railway lines, offering unique city views and art installations.
activities.evening: Greenwich Village & Jazz Club Experience: Explore the charming streets of Greenwich Village. Dinner: Grab an authentic New York slice at Joe's Pizza. Afterwards, immerse yourself in the city's legendary jazz scene with a Greenwich Village Jazz Club Experience (e.g., Blue Note).

dinner_recommendation.name: Joe's Pizza (Greenwich Village)
dinner_recommendation.specialty: The quintessential, no-frills New York slice – thin crust, perfect cheese-to-sauce ratio, and a classic chew.

activities.morning: Relaxed morning or visit a small museum/gallery. Consider a walk through Washington Square Park.
activities.afternoon: Bushwick Street Art & Brewery Tour: Head to Bushwick, Brooklyn, to explore its incredible street art scene. You can do a self-guided tour or join a guided one. Afterwards, visit one of Bushwick's local breweries for a tasting.
activities.evening: NYC Rooftop Bar Experience: Head back to Manhattan for a chic NYC Rooftop Bar Experience (e.g., 230 Fifth Rooftop Bar) to enjoy cocktails with fantastic city views, especially at sunset. Dinner at a restaurant convenient to the rooftop bar's location.

dinner_recommendation.name: Various Options Near Rooftop Bar
dinner_recommendation.specialty: Choose from numerous restaurants in the Flatiron or Nomad area for diverse dinner options.

activities.morning: Enjoy a slower morning, perhaps visit a unique shop or gallery in SoHo or the Lower East Side.
activities.afternoon: Katz's Delicatessen & East Village Exploration: Indulge in an iconic New York lunch at Katz's Delicatessen. Afterwards, explore the bohemian and eclectic East Village neighborhood, known for its historic buildings, unique boutiques, and vibrant atmosphere.
activities.evening: Glamorous Dinner in Lower East Side: Enjoy a stylish dinner experience at Beauty & Essex, known for its speakeasy entrance and delicious tapas-style dishes. Reservations are highly recommended.

dinner_recommendation.name: Beauty & Essex
dinner_recommendation.specialty: A glamorous dining experience with a speakeasy entrance (through a pawn shop) leading to a chic restaurant and lounge.

activities.morning: Central Park Exploration: Spend your morning exploring parts of Central Park. You can rent a bike, visit Bethesda Terrace, Strawberry Fields, or simply enjoy a walk through this urban oasis.
activities.afternoon: Visit a world-class museum (e.g., The Metropolitan Museum of Art, American Museum of Natural History – if time permits and interests) or enjoy some shopping on Fifth Avenue.
activities.evening: Comedy Cellar Experience: Enjoy dinner in Greenwich Village (perhaps trying a different local spot from Day 3) before heading to the legendary Comedy Cellar for a night of stand-up comedy, often featuring surprise celebrity guests.

dinner_recommendation.name: Xi'an Famous Foods
dinner_recommendation.specialty: Spicy, flavorful hand-ripped noodles and unique regional Chinese dishes, a true adventure for the taste buds.

activities.morning: Last-minute souvenir shopping, revisiting a favorite spot, or enjoying a final New York brunch.
activities.afternoon: Depending on your flight schedule, enjoy a final walk through a favorite neighborhood or relax before heading to the airport for departure.

localTips: Master the subway: It's the fastest way to navigate the city. Get a MetroCard or use OMNY with your contactless payment method.
Walk on the right side of sidewalks and escalators, keep moving, and remember tipping 18-20% for good service is customary and expected.
Always be aware of your surroundings, especially in crowded areas like Times Square or the subway; keep valuables secure in front pockets or a cross-body bag.
Pack comfortable walking shoes – you'll be doing a lot of walking – and dress in layers as New York weather can change quickly throughout the day.
Visit popular attractions like museums or observation decks early in the morning on weekdays to avoid the largest crowds and enjoy a more serene experience.
For incredible, free views of the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline, take a ride on the Staten Island Ferry, departing from Lower Manhattan.
Credit cards are widely accepted everywhere, but it's always wise to carry some USD cash for smaller vendors, street food, or emergencies.
